alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 04 at 6:24PM CDT until June 04 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BRISCOE AND SWISHER COUNTIES... At 624 PM CDT, Heavy rain has moved out of the warning area but the flooding threat continues. The West Texas Mesonet at Happy recorded 0.72 inches in 20 minutes at 430 PM. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Tulia, Silverton, Happy, Vigo Park, Mackenzie Reservoir and Claytonville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
